header.headertext: NINTH MARSHALLED LIST OF AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN GRAND COMMITTEE
The amendments have been marshalled in accordance with the Instruction of 4th June 2013, asÂ follows—
Clause 38 Schedule 2 Clauses 39 to 41 Schedule 3 Clause 42 Clauses 52 to 55 Clauses 137 to 142
[Amendments marked * are new or have been altered]

text.quote: 55ALA*: Clause 38, page 22, line 4, at end insert—
“( ) This section shall cease to have effect two years following enactment.”
55ALB*: Schedule 2, page 111, line 32, leave out “with the consent of the Department of” and insert “jointly with the Minister for”
55ALC*: Schedule 2, page 113, line 5, after “Act” insert “and before January 2016”
55ALD*: Schedule 2, page 113, line 29, leave out paragraphs (c) and (d)
55ALE*: Schedule 2, page 115, line 15, leave out sub-paragraphs (5) and (6) and insert—

“(5) An instrument containing regulations which make provision falling within paragraph 6, 7, 8, 9, 12 or 13 (whether or not also making any other provision) may not be made unless the instrument has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, each House of Parliament.
(6) The first regulations under paragraph 10 or 11 may not be made unless the instrument has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, each House of Parliament.”

55ALF*: Clause 39, page 22, line 30, leave out from “be” to end of line 31 and insert “sufficient to ensure there is no conflict of interest between the system operator’s EMR and commercial priorities”
55AM: Clause 53, page 53, line 22, leave out “or (4)” and insert “, (4) or (6A)”
55B: After Clause 53, insert the following new Clause—
“Domestic microhydro power
(1) Domestically based microhydro power shall be exempt from non-domestic rates.

(2) For the purposes of the section “domestically based microhydro power” is a single plant located within the curtelege of an owner or owner’s residential property with a plant capacity of up to and including 1250 kW.”
55C: After Clause 55, insert the following new Clause—
“Reduction of landfilling of organic waste
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State must, as soon as reasonably practicable, set out a plan and timeframe for the reduction and eventual elimination of landfilling of organic waste in order to make it available for 100% renewable energy generation, and other appropriate uses consistent with the waste hierarchy as defined in the Waste (England and Wales) Regulations 2011.”

text.quote: 55D: After Clause 55, insert the following new Clause—
“Energy storage systems
text.IndentOne: (a) set out a plan to support the development of storage systems for electricity that is generated from renewable sources,
(b) put in place pilot schemes to store renewable energy and reduce the problem associated with intermittency of supply,
(c) set targets in relation to the provision of renewable energy storage capacity, and
(d) set out progress made on these issues in the form of a report, which must be laid before Parliament.”

text.quote: 55E*: After Clause 55, insert the following new Clause—
“Voltage optimisation
text.IndentOne: Within 12 months of enactment, the Secretary of State shall publish a strategy to support the development and usage of commercial and domestic voltage optimisation.”

text.quote: 55F*: After Clause 55, insert the following new Clause—
“Nuclear Research and Development
( ) The Secretary of State must seek to foster Research and Development in nuclear technologies, including—
text.IndentOne: (a) advanced fission and alternative fuel cycles; and
(b) profitable ways of employing Britain’s stock of plutonium in generating electricity.
text.quote: ( ) The Secretary of State must report to Parliament annually on the progress made on these issues and any necessary changes to the legal remit of the NDA in furtherance of these aims.”
55G*: Clause 139, page 107, line 41, leave out paragraph (c) and insert—
text.IndentOne: “(c) the establishment and operation of an Expert Advisory Panel to advise on the exercise by the Secretary of State of powers relating to CFDs, Investment Contracts or Capacity payments made under Part 2 of this Act.”

56A: Clause 140, page 108, line 30, at end insert—
“( ) Section (Fuel poverty) extends to England and Wales only.”
57: Clause 141, page 109, line 18, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “( ) section (Feed-in tariffs: increase in maximum capacity of plant) (feed-in tariffs: increase in maximum capacity of plant);”
